title.narrative: Burkina - Good Governance 2021-2025 - Enhance security, rule of law, human rights and effectiveness of national institutions

description.narrative:
To prevent a further escalation of conflict and to contribute to global and regional efforts against terrorism, and thereby address some of the underlying causes of refugee flows, internal displacement and potentially irregular migration towards Europe, Denmark will continue to assist the government of Burkina Faso in upholding peace and stability.
This will be achieved by enhancing security, the rule of law, human rights and effectiveness of national institutions with a view to containing the escalation of conflict as well as addressing structural causes of fragility through support to international and regional security and stabilisation efforts and support to building strong, legitimate public institutions and civil society in Burkina Faso.
The Good Governance 2021 - 2025 Programme is composed of 4 projects:
Project 1: Improvement of the judicial system and access to justice 2021-2025 This project generates better access to justice, an efficient criminal chain and an efficient judiciary which will help to restore the population's confidence in its judicial system.
Project 2: Improvement of trust between populations and internal security forces 2021-2025 In the targeted provinces, the Internal Security Forces will provide more effective protection to civilian populations while respecting human rights and the rule of law, in conjunction with civil society organizations and other actors mobilized within the framework of local security initiatives.
Project 3: Promotion of human rights, peace and social cohesion 2021-2025 Stronger CSOs with increased skill levels will implement better quality actions on the ground, promoting peace and expanding access to rights, especially for women, youth and marginalized groups.
